description: In "The Tiger's Hole," the behind-the-scenes organization of the revived wresting world, two young wrestlers take a stand. One of those fighters has inherited the training facility and mask of a tiger that Naoto Itou left at the foot of Mount Fuji. The other fighter has been victorious at fierce competitions since entering The Tiger's Hole, and has obtained the black Tiger Mask. A Tiger Mask that walks down the path of light, and a Tiger Mask that walks down the path of shadow. Neither of them have ever seen each other's face... In the ring, the two are fated rivals, but their goals are the same: "Crush The Tiger's Hole!"

tags.name: Wrestling
tags.description: Centers around the sport of wrestling.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Athletics
tags.description: Centers around sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, or walking.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

name.native: バッドラック・ファレ

node.description:
Asaki Takamori, better known by this pen names Ikki Kajiwara and Asao Takamori, was a Japanese author, manga writer, and film producer. He is known for series about sports and martial arts. He considered [Tiger Mask](https://anilist.co/manga/60575/) and [Kyojin no Hoshi](https://anilist.co/manga/45305/) to be his life's work.

Formerly married to [Bingbing Pai](https://anilist.co/staff/256250) from 1979 to 1981.

name.native: ギャルマト・ボグダン

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Bogdan_Gyarmath)

Gyarmath Bogdan is a Romanian producer belonging to Toei Animation. His wife is sports journalist Komatsu Narumi (小松成美). He speaks seven languages, such as Japanese, English and Romanian.

Gyarmath's father was Hungarian and his mother Romanian. He studied cross-cultural communication at the Bucharest University and took actively part in the Romanian Revolution of 1989. Hereafter he had to flee the country and migrated to his father's birth country Hungary. There he studied Japanese Culture at Budapest University. In 1992 he came to Japan, where he continued his studies at the Chiba University. In 1998 he married Komatsu Narumi. He joined Toei Animation as translator in August, 2006. 

(Source: AniDB)
